THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING BEEN FINALLY HEARD ON 03.01.2019,
THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING:

Crl.MC.No. 16 of 2019 2 201KERIS
ORDER

Petition filed under Section 482 Cr.P.C.

2. Petitioner is the accused in C.C.No.165
of 2017 on the file of the Judicial Magistrate of
First Class-I, Kasaragod. He is alleged to have
committed the offences under Sections 324 and 341
IPC. Second respondent is the victim. It is
submitted that the matter has been settled and
the proceedings in the trial court may be
quashed.

3. Heard the learned counsel for _ the
petitioner and second respondent and the learned
Public Prosecutor.

4. I have perused the affidavit filed by
the second respondent, who has entered appearance
through counsel. I am satisfied that the matter
has been settled and no public interest is
involved in this case. There is no impediment
for granting the prayer of the petitioner.

Crl.MC.No. 16 of 2019 3 2019/KERIS
In the result, this Crl.M.C. is allowed. The

proceedings in C.C.No.165 of 2017 on the file of
the Judicial Magistrate of First Class-I,
Kasaragod are quashed. If any material objects
have been produced in this case, the trial court
may pass appropriate orders for their disposal.

Sd/-

K. ABRAHAM MATHEW

JUDGE

MC/03.01.19
